snippet: A federal appeals court ruled private arbitration agreements are enforceable in a case over Uber’s background checks, which the company may use to fight other class-action cases....
abstract: Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in California rules that Uber drivers are subject to individual arbitration in class-action case over background checks; decision overturns previous ruling, where private arbitration was seen as unenforceable.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ruled private arbitration agreements are enforceable in a case over Uber’s background checks, which the company may use to fight other class-action cases.

headline.main: Ruling Tips Uber Drivers Away From Class-Action Suits
headline.print_headline: Ruling Tips Uber Drivers Away From Class-Action Suits
